N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 452.1 - Schedule of fees

State Regulations

The following schedule of fees is imposed for courses offered
by and use of the Academy of Fire Science. (a) For fire-related courses and seminars
regularly scheduled by OFPC: (1)

New York

State resident registration............$25 per course or seminar; (2)
out-of-state resident registration............$50 per course or seminar; (3)
meals and lodging as provided in
subdivision (d) of this section. (b) For courses and seminars presented to
other State agencies and to private sector groups: (1)

New York State resident registration............$60 per course or seminar; (2)
out-of-state resident registration............$100 per course or seminar; (3)
meals and lodging as provided in
subdivision (d) of this section. (c) For use of Academy facilities only: (1)
fire service-related groups--no
charge. (2)
(i) Other groups (per room-per day): (a) classroom--$100 (maximum occupancy 30
persons); (b) conference room--$100
(maximum occupancy 32 persons); (c) auditorium--$200 (maximum occupancy 220 persons); (d) burn building (no fire)--$150 (per
day); (e) burn building (with
fire)--$500 per room (per day); (f) sprinkler lab--$200 (per day). (ii)

Where in connection with such use
registration of individuals is handled through the academy, a charge of $10 per
registrant is imposed. (iii)

Where
in connection with such use registration of individuals is handled by the
utilizing group, a charge of $5 per registrant is imposed. (iv)

Where in connection with such use, meals
and lodging are desired, the rates in subdivision (d) of this section shall
apply. (d) For meals and lodging (for all Academy attendees): (1)
meals and lodging for course registrants............$40 per day; (2)
meals
purchased separately: (i) breakfast............$4; (ii)
lunch............$4; (iii)
dinner............$9. (e) For canine accelerant detection training
programs (initial certification): (1)

New

York State resident registration............$25 per course; (2)
out-of-state resident registration............$50 per course; (3)
meals and lodging as provided in subdivision (d) of this section; (4)
canine/handler training and materials
cost, including canine examination, shots, etc.............$750; (5)
canine accelerant detection
recertification............$100. (f) Basic fire training course for municipal
fire departments (six-week training course): (1)

New York State resident registration............$100 per course; (2)
out-of-state resident registration............$200 per course; (3)
meals and lodging as provided in
subdivision (d) of this section. Notes
